intro: Ardisia compressa var. mexicana, commonly known as Mexican beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its small, dark purple berries that appear in clusters. The plant has glossy, elliptical leaves and produces fragrant white flowers in the spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and partial to full shade. This ornamental shrub is valued for its attractive foliage and seasonal berries.
